column14: !Sample_molecule_ch1
column16: !Sample_extract_protocol_ch1
column17: !Sample_taxid_ch1
column18: !Sample_description
column19: !Sample_data_processing
column22: !Sample_data_processing
column23: !Sample_data_processing
column24: !Sample_platform_id
column26: !Sample_contact_institute

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.

column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive (HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.

column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: double positive (ER+ and HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.

column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: double positive (ER+ and HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: double positive (ER+ and HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.

column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive (HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive (HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.

column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column11: molecular subtype: human epidermal growth factor receptor 2 positive (HER2+)
column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). RNA spike-ins 1
column17: 4 and 7 from ArrayControl TM RNA Spikes (ThermoFisher) were added to the lysis mix for validation of array and batch effect. Bulk RNAs were extracted from ~1x10^5 cells of suspensions or tumor tissues using RNeasy Plus Micro kit (Qiagen) and 10ng of total RNAs were amplified with SMARTer kit (Clonetech) under the same conditions as single cells. All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.

column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm). All of amplified cDNAs were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies). Total 549 single cell cDNAs and 14 bulk samples were subjected to the RNA sequencing.
column18: Starting with 0.375 ng of amplified cDNAs
column19: sequencing libraries were constructed with the Nextera XT DNA Sample Prep Kit (Illumina). All of constructed libraries were quantified and qualified by the Qubit® 2.0 Fluorometer (Life Technologies) and 2100 Bioanalyzer (Agilent Technologies) then pooled without index overlapping. Finally pooled libraries were sequenced using the HiSeq2500 (Illumina) as 100-bp paired-end mode of the TruSeq Rapid PE Cluster kit and TruSeq Rapid SBS kit.
column22: A modified reference was generated by merging the three array control RNA spike-ins (ThermoFisher) and the human genome reference (hg19) with the GENCODE 19 annotations.
column23: Paired-end 100bp reads were aligned to the modified reference by 2-pass mode of STAR_2.4.0b with default parameters.
column24: Transcripts Per Million (TPM) values were estimated using RSEM v1.2.17 with default parameters.
column26: Supplementary_files_format_and_content: A processed file is tab-delimited and contains the raw TPM values for 549 single cells and 14 bulk tumors.

column14: all single cells were dissociated with mechanical and enzymatical method then immediately used for assay without any in vitro culture.
column16: Dead cells in single cell suspensions were removed by Ficoll-Paque TM PLUS (GE healthcare) separation before loading to integrated fluidic circuit (IFC) chip. Each suspension was loaded to 10-17um IFC for mRNA sequencing chip then cDNA synthesis and amplification were performed with SMARTer Ultra Low RNA Kit (Clontech) in the C1TM Single-Cell Auto Prep System (Fluidigm).
